title: 'SNL' cold open reveals who the cast really voted for
description: The 'Saturday Night Live' cold open featured the main cast sarcastically sharing their support for Donald Trump and unveiled a flattering new impression of the Orange One.
excerpt: The 'Saturday Night Live' cast were Trumpers all along.
text: The 'Saturday Night Live' cast were Trumpers all along. Now that the votes are in, the Saturday Night Live cast can confess that they've been with Donald Trump "all along." In full deadpan, cast members Bowen Yang, Ego Nwodim, Kenan Thompson, Heidi Gardner, Marcello Hernandez, Sarah Sherman, and Colin Jost shared their support for President-elect Trump. "We see ourselves in you," said Nwodim, "we look at you and think, 'that's me.'" In an bid to get on the future leader of free world's good side, the SNL cast is willing to rat out anyone who voted for Kamala Harris. That included Jost who gleefully called out his Weekend Update co-anchor Michael Che for being a part of the "lame-stream media."And if that wasn't enough to appeal to Trump, the cast introduced James Austin Johnson's flattering new portrayal of Trump in his yoked Cobra Kai-esque glory. The cast even gave us a glimpse of "the other man we love and trust," Elon Musk (played by Dana Carvey) doing his double fist pump jumping thing. Maybe that means we'll see more Musk impressions in the future. Cecily is a tech reporter at Mashable who covers AI, Apple, and emerging tech trends. Before getting her master's degree at Columbia Journalism School, she spent several years working with startups and social impact businesses for Unreasonable Group and B Lab. Before that, she co-founded a startup consulting business for emerging entrepreneurial hubs in South America, Europe, and Asia. You can find her on Twitter at @cecily_mauran. html:
The 'Saturday Night Live' cast were Trumpers all along.

Now that the votes are in, the Saturday Night Live cast can confess that they've been with Donald Trump "all along."

In full deadpan, cast members Bowen Yang, Ego Nwodim, Kenan Thompson, Heidi Gardner, Marcello Hernandez, Sarah Sherman, and Colin Jost shared their support for President-elect Trump. "We see ourselves in you," said Nwodim, "we look at you and think, 'that's me.'"

In an bid to get on the future leader of free world's good side, the SNL cast is willing to rat out anyone who voted for Kamala Harris. That included Jost who gleefully called out his Weekend Update co-anchor Michael Che for being a part of the "lame-stream media."

And if that wasn't enough to appeal to Trump, the cast introduced James Austin Johnson's flattering new portrayal of Trump in his yoked Cobra Kai-esque glory. The cast even gave us a glimpse of "the other man we love and trust," Elon Musk (played by Dana Carvey) doing his double fist pump jumping thing. Maybe that means we'll see more Musk impressions in the future.

Cecily is a tech reporter at Mashable who covers AI, Apple, and emerging tech trends. Before getting her master's degree at Columbia Journalism School, she spent several years working with startups and social impact businesses for Unreasonable Group and B Lab. Before that, she co-founded a startup consulting business for emerging entrepreneurial hubs in South America, Europe, and Asia. You can find her on Twitter at @cecily_mauran.
